title: Bridging the Wound Gap: Interim Results From Randomized Trials Evaluating Dehydrated Human Amnion-Intermediate Layer-Chorion Membrane for the Treatment of Non-healing Diabetic Foot Ulcers.
abstract: Introduction Patients with diabetes frequently develop diabetic foot ulcers, a significant clinical pathology that results in increased morbidity and mortality. Standard of care (SOC) treatment has been insufficient to prevent the poor outcomes associated with these wounds. This analysis aims to evaluate the supplementation of SOC with a human tissue allograft. Methods This evaluation is of two prospective, multicenter, randomized clinical studies (ELITE - ongoing and CAMPLIFE - terminated) comparing a dehydrated human amnion-intermediate layer-chorion membrane (dHAICM) tissue allograft (AmchoPlast
